Comments_List:
Presentation skills and synthesizing ideas relative to our stage in the doctoral program.
Having all doctoral students together provides a great opportunity to learn from other students at various stages in their doctoral work.
Presentation timing and clarity of communication.
Have more outlines for dissertation benchmarks.

Having to present in front of the group was a great opportunity.  The process also encouraged my own development of ideas over the course of the semester, and feedback and ideas from peers was really helpful in framing my own research and thinking about where to go next.  It was also great to absorb comments from students on others' presentations and apply to my own thinking.

I think that the main way to improve the course would be for the presenter to better direct the feedback being sought. For example, giving students not in the same cohort the first chances to ask questions. I found that their input was the most helpful at the time because they had "fresh eyes".
yes, nice to receive feedback on dissertation
